channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Flooding outside door as you have not fixed a tarmacing error from almost 2 years ago. Which created a ditch for water to sit in. The assessor came at beginning of this year to say will be done by next April 2026? Is that normal. I think not. I will have to take legal action against Gloucestershire Highway for not taking my concerns seriously enough. Nobody should have to wait almost 2 years to rectify a problem caused by your contractors., 14th November
item.description:
Outside 35 Sandford Street GL537JR. It's the only house with a big pool thanks to serious negligence on my street outside.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, King George Close, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drain when we have heavy rain, 14th November
item.description:
The drain is outside number 31 drain was ok until new drain cover was replaced by highway maintenance few weeks ago and now every time it rains this happens and It’s making it hard to get into my front door as seen by first photo

item.category: Complete bollard is damaged (Non illuminating bollard or post)

item.title: Flooding, 14th November
item.description:
Ref No 8187231 .Today at 2 15 subway under A 417 Elmbridge Court Roundabout flooded ,fly tipping not cleared ,plus a accident damaged car dumped ,not a safe ,clean environment for walkers Or cyclists ,why is this area so neglected ?it s a Feeder section for ( Game Changer) cycle spine , and the only road in and out for Elmbridge Court Bussiness Park , overall not a example for visitors to Churchdown or Gloucestershire

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: To take an individual photo will not show the extent of the problem.Since the temporary closure of the A40 at Charlton Kings the road from Whittington to Aggs Hill is experiencing far too much traffic by people using it as a shortcut to Cheltenham making it unbearably busy and with little thought to local people .The road is collapsing in many places along with the verges.As a matter of some urgency repair work will be necessary once normal traffic resumes with the re-opening of the A 40 once the bridge repairs are completed ., 14th November
item.description:
All of the road from Whalley Farm to Aggs Hill is disintegrating due to excessive use by people using the road as a shortcut to Cheltenham due to the road closure on the A40 at Charlton Kings .
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Enfield Road & pavements needs resurfacing, 14th November
item.description:
Good afternoon my name is Mr. Gilbert. I live on Elmfield Road Cheltenham GL51 9JJ. The road and the pavement on Elmfield Road are absolutely worn out and needs servicing not just repairing potholes. The whole road is worn out. It is now that bad with some of our friends Refused to come down the road because of the damage it does to their cars. I know you’re probably pretty pushed at the moment I have reported this before but nothing‘s been done. The road is completely worn out. I’ve lived here 20 years and it’s never been resurfaced so please would somebody come and look at it? Enfield Road feed Saint Peter School there is an awful lot of traffic between 840 and 910 and 340 and 310 probably doesn’t help. Would someone get back to me and let me know what’s happening? My number is 07836354401 Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1;3;5;7;9;11, Sun Street, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The drain is blocked problem, 14th November
item.description:
Email received 12/11/2025 - copy attached. Customer reports that the gulley O/S the location is blocked and unable to cope during heavy rainfall. The excess water is running off onto the nearby drive; this has been flooded twice this year already. They ask that the drain is cleared out.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 14th November
item.description:
This year there was a tree survey carried out by the highways agency on a copper beech tree outside 24E and 24F Moorend road, Cheltenham. Talking to both the highways representative and tree assessment official after the assessment, they indicated that the tree would need its canopy severely reduced or felled completely due to the worsening condition of the tree (it has 2 large holes in it's trunk at the base of the canopy).
Report on FixMyStreet
